page.title: 09Pennyland School
page.content: This school was opened on 28th August 1962. We have 339 pupils who work in 16 classrooms on 3 levels, the Infant Department being on the ground floor. There are 15 fulltime and 6 part-time teachers, including a headmaster. School begins at 09.00 and closes at 15.30 with 1 hour for lunch and 20 minutes for playtime. We have 2 weeks holidays in October,at Christmas and Easter and 5 weeks in summer.This year we have done project work on Scotland, Caithness and newspapers.Scottish history began with St.Columba and ended with Robert the Bruce at the Battle of Bannockburn in 1314. Novels that we studied were The Kelpie's Pearls & The Enchanted Whistle both by Mollie Hunter. Everyone likes Art and Arithmetic, but each has a different dislike. School sports are swimming, games & athletics.We have 3 computers.
